firebase-ai.author: Rodrigo Lazo
firebase-ai.message:
[AI] Don't end connection early when receiving GoAway (#7688)

Instead of finishing the session when the go away message is received,
keeping it open leaves more room for developers to implement different
strategies in their callback method. Additionally, it preserves the
current behaviour.

firebase-ai.author: Rodrigo Lazo

- Update entries in Changelog
- Update api.txt
- Update version

firebase-ai.author: David Motsonashvili
firebase-ai.message:
Add Firebase AI KSP Processor (#7523)

* Adds the `Generable` and `Guide` annotations
* Adds the KSP processor to turn them into firebase AI schema objects
* Adds publishing plugin to export maven repo for ADMRS

firebase-ai.author: YooJun Hong
firebase-ai.message:
[AI] Fix crash caused by unhandled goAway server message in LiveSession (#7649)

## Description

Fixes #7648

This PR adds support for the `goAway` server message type in LiveSession
to prevent crashes when the server initiates a disconnect. Previously,
when the server sent a `goAway` message, the app would crash with a
`SerializationException` because the message type was not recognized by
`LiveServerMessageSerializer`.

## Changes

### 1. Add LiveServerGoAway message type

- Added `LiveServerGoAway` class to represent server-initiated
disconnection
- Includes `timeLeft: Duration?` field from parsed protobuf format
string (e.g., "57s", "1.5s")
- Registered `goAway` message in `LiveServerMessageSerializer`

### 2. Robust Handling & API Update

- **Graceful Shutdown:** Implemented logic in `processModelResponses()`
to recognize `GoAway` signals and automatically close the session,
preventing zombie connections or further crashes.
- **Public API:** Added `goAwayHandler` to
`LiveAudioConversationConfig`.
- *Rationale:* While internal handling prevents the crash, apps often
need to inform the user that the session ended due to server maintenance
or timeouts. This handler exposes the `timeLeft` information to the
application layer.

## Usage Example

Apps can now handle server disconnections gracefully using the
`goAwayHandler`:

```kotlin
val config = LiveAudioConversationConfig.Builder()
  .setGoAwayHandler { goAway ->
    Log.i(TAG, "Server disconnecting in ${goAway.timeLeft?.inWholeSeconds} seconds")
    // Clean up resources, show UI notification, etc.
  }
  .build()

liveGenerativeModel.startAudioConversation(config)
```

## Testing

- unit tests
- Tested with [real
app](https://github.com/android/ai-samples/tree/prototype-ai-glasses)
and confirmed graceful handling of goAway messages (Published to local
Maven)
- Spotless formatting applied

## Related Issues

- Android SDK: #7648
- Flutter SDK: https://github.com/firebase/flutterfire/issues/17836

---------

Co-authored-by: Rodrigo Lazo <rlazo@users.noreply.github.com>

firebase-ai.author: Rodrigo Lazo
firebase-ai.message:
[AI] Graduate UrlContext to GA (#7686)

The feature is no longer gated behind the opt-in `@PublicPreviewAPI`.

Internal b/441102128

firebase-ai.author: Rodrigo Lazo
firebase-ai.message:
[AI] Include the "X-Android-Package" and "X-Android-Cert" headers (#7679)

These headers are necessary to support [API Key
restrictions](https://docs.cloud.google.com/docs/authentication/api-keys#adding-application-restrictions).
This feature enable you to limit which apps (by matching package name
and certificate fingerprint) are allowed to make request.

**Important**: We still *strongly* recommend the use of Firebase App
Check instead of, or in addition to, API key restrictions.

---------

Co-authored-by: gemini-code-assist[bot] <176961590+gemini-code-assist[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>

firebase-components.message:
[Components] Fix typo when logging error (#7643)

The previous message was "Class %s is not an found." and it should be
""Class %s was not found."

firebase-firestore.author: wu-hui
firebase-firestore.message: Remove undesired exists() conditions from query-to-pipeline conversion (#7634)

appcheck/firebase-appcheck.author: Rodrigo Lazo
appcheck/firebase-appcheck.message:
[Appcheck] Use default message if getToken exception doesn't include one  (#7640)

This addresses issue
https://github.com/firebase/firebase-android-sdk/issues/7624.
Previously, missing error messages in custom providers would the Task to
fail with an null argument exception. The app check contract states that
the task **will** succeed. In the case of error, the
`AppCheckTokenResult` object returned will include the error
information.

appcheck/firebase-appcheck-debug.author: Rodrigo Lazo
appcheck/firebase-appcheck-debug.message:
[Plugin] Fix build release artifacts workflow (#7693)

Downloading the dackka binary should happen **before** gradle is run to
build the artifacts, otherwise it doesn't find it and fails.

appcheck/firebase-appcheck-debug.author: Rodrigo Lazo
appcheck/firebase-appcheck-debug.message:
[AppCheck] Add missing changelog entries. (#7692)

The change introduced in (#7640) triggers a release of app check, and all SDKs must contain a changelog entry for it.
